Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegations
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegations 
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with a delegation of Koreans from Japan headed by Ryang Su Jong, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings on April 16.
 On the same day, he met and conversed with a delegation of the Communist Party of Greece led by Aleka Papariga, general secretary of the Central Committee of the CPG, in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

Kim Il Sung Lauded as Peerlessly Great Man
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded as Peerlessly Great Man 
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was a peerlessly great man who made a history of steady victory in the spirit of revolutionary optimism, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a signed article.
 His life was a brilliant one characterized by revolutionary optimism and an immortal history full of faith in sure victory and optimism, the article says, and goes on:
 His whole life represented an immortal revolutionary life of a great man who successfully explored the road of the Korean revolution, overcoming the most difficult and manifold hardships with faith in the victory of revolution and optimism without the slightest pessimism, despair, failure and frustration. He had always had the spirit of emerging victorious, converting misfortune into fortune and adversity into favorable conditions and he had such matchless pluck that there is always a way out. He thus always brought about only victory despite the stern tempest of the revolution.
 He who laughs last laughs the best. It was with this optimism and pluck that the President did everything he could have done for the accomplishment of the Juche cause by victoriously leading the protracted and arduous Korean revolution.
 He, with a deep insight into the historical necessity of succession to the revolutionary cause, found the most successful solution to the issue of succession to the leadership, thereby giving steady continuity to the revolutionary cause. This is the greatest feat that can be performed only by a great man born of Heaven capable of looking far into the future.    
 The President's great optimism is a noble revolutionary spirit based on the firm faith in the validity of the revolutionary cause, the popular masses' cause of independence.
 This is also a revolutionary spirit based on the absolute trust in the inexhaustible strength of the people and unbounded love for the homeland and people.
 The article says that the President's glorious history of revolutionary optimism is now being given steady continuity under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

Kim Jong Il Sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends for Korean Children in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends for Korean Children in Japan
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent educational aid fund and stipends of 234.5 million yen in Japanese currency for the development of democratic national education of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
 The educational aid fund and stipends sent by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the sons and daughters of Korean residents in Japan amount to 4576, 8223,000 yen in the 152nd installment.    
 The deep loving care shown to the children of Koreans under Chongryon on the occasion of the Day of the Sun will greatly encourage Koreans in Japan in dedicating themselves to the prosperity of the socialist homeland, national reunification and the strengthening of the movement of Koreans in Japan and contribute to the development of democratic national education of Chongryon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Phyo Mu Won
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Phyo Mu Won
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il Monday sent a wreath to the bier of Phyo Mu Won, KPA general officer who is winner of   Kim Il Sung Order and the National Reunification Prize, expressing deep condolences on his death.

articles.title: Cambodian King Arrives Here
articles.content:
Cambodian King Arrives Here
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni arrived in Pyongyang by a special plane Monday to pay an official visit to Korea at the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People�fs Assembly. 
 The king was welcomed at the airport by Kim Yong Nam, Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Ro Tu Chol, Minister of Culture Kim Jin Song, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il and DPRK Ambassador to Cambodia Choe Han Chun. 
 Out at the airport were Cambodian Ambassador to the DPRK Chhorn Hay and embassy officials.    
 A ceremony for welcoming the Cambodian king was held at the airport.
 Norodom Sihamoni, together with Kim Yong Nam, reviewed the honor guards of the three services of the Korean People's Army.

China Donates Equipment to Korean Hydro-Meteorological Service
articles.content:
China Donates Equipment to Korean Hydro-Meteorological Service
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Water Resources of China donated equipment for communications and hydrological observation to the Hydro-Meteorological Service of the DPRK.
 A donation ceremony was held here Monday.    
 Present at the ceremony were Ko Il Hun, director of the Hydro-Meteorological Service, and officials concerned, Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy officials and members of the delegation of the Chinese Ministry of Water Resources headed by Deng Jian, director of the Bureau of Hydrology.
 Speeches were made on the occasion.
